g.text: XRD patterns indicate the presence of superlattice structures. The intensity of the superstructural peaks increases
with an increase in the content of Zn
which indicates the enhancement in the periodicity of the NCs.
The morphology of the as-synthesized NCs is investigated using transmission electron microscopy (TEM). The
) show the uniformly distributed nanocubes without a change in morphology even after
in the parent NCs. However, the average side length of CsZn
is increased from 0% to 15%. The decrease in particle size at high content of Zn
be a result of increased halide ion uptake, which hinders the crystal growth
of as-grown samples is illustrated in Fig.Â
. From these histograms, it can be concluded that the particle size
distribution also decreases with increasing the content of Zn
. Thus, from the XRD and TEM analysis, we found
results in the increase in periodicity and uniformity of the NCs with a decrease in
The effect of the inclusion of Zn
on the optical properties of CsPbX
ing PL and absorption spectra as shown in Fig.Â
. The normalized PL and absorption spectra of CsZn
exhibit a modest blue-shift with increasing Zn
precursors contain the same halides, this paves a pathway for the inclusion of Zn
upon its introduction into the host CsPbX
matrix and favors the change in the optical properties of Zn
NCs exhibit PL emission in the violet region with emission peak attenuated from
417 nm to 411 nm (excited at 300 nm), whereas CsZn
NCs, show the green emission which is tuned from
522 nm to 517 nm (excited at 365 nm). This blue-shift in the optical properties is related to the slight decrease in
the size of the NCs that can be ascribed to the weak quantum confinement effect. The full width at half-maximum
NCs is decreased from 13.4 nm to 12.8 nm and that of CsZn
NCs is decreased from 16.9 nm to 15.5 nm when the content of Zn
is increased from 0% to 15%. The narrow
FWHM shows that the obtained NCs are uniformly distributed and decreased FWHM indicates an increase in
the uniformity in the size distribution of NCs. This observation is also in agreement with the TEM images. In
Structural and morphological properties of CsZn
NCs at a different content of Zn
) TEM images (scale bar, 50 nm) of the NCs.
) Histograms showing size distribution of corresponding NCs.
